data.title: Great in-house choice!
data.text: I had several meals here, and all of them were very good.  I highly recommend their breakfast buffet.

data.title: Great breakfast buffet
data.text: Many choices for those eating healthy, various eggs dishes (frittata is my favorite), yogurt and fruit plus an array of cereals. They also make individual omelets and muffins, toast, breads, sausage, bacon etc.

data.title: Nothing Special for Breakfast Buffet
data.text: I'm not usually one to eat hotel restaurant food.  I had the breakfast buffet.  It was "ok"; nothing special.  Always nice when you can take your plate back upstairs to your room.

data.title: PRINCESS WAS PRICELESS
data.text: We stayed in the DoubleTree Hotel and this is located on the first floor of the hotel. We had visited with Princess during Happy Hour in the Lounge and then discovered that she would be our waitress for the dinner as well. The dinner was perfect but the service was even better. Thank you, Princess. You were Priceless.

data.title: My favorite Breakfast place
data.text: This Bistro is in the Double Tree Hotel and we had a great hot breakfast every morning...The service is fantastic and the selection of different types of foods are fantastic....

data.title: Pleasantly Surprised
data.text:
Checked in to the Doubletree and just didn't want to go out. 

I ordered the soup and salad with the Rigatoni Bolognese.   Very delicious. 

Felt the prices were good as well for being in a hotel and it matches the quality.

data.title: A bit pricey, but good food that bucks the "hotel food" stigma
data.text: Well designed and presented dishes at breakfast. Fresh, good texture, good variety within the buffet.

data.title: Breakfast and Room Service
data.text: You can order breakfast from the menu or do the buffet. I was in a bit of a hurry, so I did the buffet. The was a lot to choose from and it was very good. I also ordered room service and the food was good as well. Not 5 star restaurant good, but good.

data.title: Nice Breakfast Option
data.text: Quick and easy Breakfast Option.  Seemed a little understaffed, but not a major issue.  Good variety for a hot continental breakfast.

data.title: Don't Waste Your Money
data.text: We ate at John Ryan's Bistro because we were staying at the Double Tree where the restaurant is located. We ate breakfast.  It's less than average food.  You can get much better food near the hotel. The watermelon had more rind on it than melon.  The muffin was dry.  The bacon, however, was very good.  The sausage gravy must have come out if a can.  The spinach quiche was under cooked and mushy.  For over $15 per person, go somewhere else.

data.title: Ho Hum
data.text: You can do better than this.  We had dinner here at 6:30 on a Saturday night, and were the only ones in the restaurant.  That should have told us something.

data.title: 3 meals=awesome!
data.text: While staying at the DoubleTree we ate at the bistro each day for breakfast, once for lunch, and once for dinner. Breakfast was awesome with a good offering of southern favorites, fresh baked goods and good quality foods. The lunch buffet had to be the BEST deal on the river. 9.95 for a souther buffet with amazing selections and a fresh salad bar. Dinner was equally as nice with a Romantic feel even though it's in a hotel.

data.title: I'll give it another try
data.text: We arrived about 12:30 p.m. and were the only ones in the restaurant.  But service was very very slow.  And they mixed up my order; I ordered a spinach salad and received their garden salad, which was ok.  No bread or crackers were offered to go with the salad.  They reason I'll give it another try is because the other girls enjoyed their meals.

data.title: Good food and service
data.text: The restaurant offers a nice selection of southern dishes and the prices are very competitive with other places in the area.  The staff is very friendly, responsive and attentive.   Atmosphere is OK but nothing extra special.

data.title: Great Southern Breakfast, nice staff
data.text: This little restaurant is located inside the Doubletree hotel on Bay Street. The staff was amazingly nice constantly checking in on us to be sure all was well. The Southern Breakfast is a full breakfast - with grits and bacon and eggs and sausage etc. They will also cook to order omelets or French toast etc as part of that. The lunch and dinner menus are more limited but what they offered was good. It was clean and bright.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Srevice  was quick & efficient. We tried ordering a bottle of wine, the waitress returned, out of that wine, chose another white wine, stated that was warm & place it in some ice. Prices on the web site are not as the inhouse menu.. $13.95 for a hamberger & fries ( fresh cut but cold & soggy ). Hamburger was overdone Some items where not on the menu at the restaurant. . I also find it hard to belive it was 1/2 lb precooked either. Wife had fish taco's, they tasted OK but at $17.00 not worth it. Will not be back.

data.title: Good Breakfast
data.text: They have an extensive breakfast buffet for $15.00. Also, they custom cooked any kind of eggs, waffles, pancakes, french toast and omelets. Friendly, excellent, caring service.

data.title: Restaurant in the Doubletree Savannah Historic Hotel
data.text: Loved the breakfast.  The handouts in the hotel room should include the fact that oatmeal is included as one of the cereals.  I was happy to find that in the restaurant on the breakfast buffet.

data.title: A treat for your mouth
data.text: The food was EXELLCENT in taste and portions. Staff is top of the line in service.  You will be pleased with the time you send in this baeutiful bistro. Even the children I saw were happy to be there and enjoying their food. I would recommend this bistro to all my friends and family that visit Savannah and would like a great meal.

data.title: Surprisingly good food for a hotel restaurant
data.text: We had Christmas lunch at this restaurant and couldn't have been more surprised.  They had a special menu that day but everything was delicious.  The pasta salad was exceptional and the turkey was tender and juicy!  We had the strawberry cobbler for dessert and it was yummy!!!  I would highly recommend and wish we had tried the restaurant sooner in our visit.
